item.description:
It's time for the penultimate concert in the series of FREE classical music concerts for the spring!

Tonight features the NEC Chamber Orchestra, a conductorless group, coached by Donald Palma, of the famed New York Orpheus Chamber Orchestra. Tonight's program features a Handel Concerto, Schoenberg's Transfigured Night, and Mozart's Violin Concerto No. 3, performed by Semion Gavrikov, who won a student concerto competition. (I've included a sample of each piece below-- this time they're all quite listenable!)

For more information about this concert, go to http://www.necmusic.e...


The concert starts at 8pm, but let's meet up at 7:30, so the group has a chance to get good seats and socialize before the concert. We usually end up sitting in the back full row of the center floor section, since this affords a good view of the entire orchestra, is open to the ceiling, and is easy to describe and find.

Directions to Jordan Hall:
The hall is located at the corner of Huntington and Gainsborough streets, about a block south of the Symphony T stop on the Green Line. Look for the building with the YMCA sign on top of it--it's in that building. The main entrance is reached from Gainsborough Street.


This evening's program will include:


  • Handel Concerto Grosso in A Minor, Op. 6, No. 4, HWV322 listen here
  • Schoenberg Verkl√§rte Nacht (Transfigured Night) listen to the 1st part here
  • Mozart's Violin Concerto No. 3 in G-major, K. 216 listen to the 1st movement here
item.how_to_find_us: I will stand in the lobby until 7:45, after which I will join the group, either in the left section of the main floor or upstairs to the left-middle balcony section (if it's open.)
item.name: Classical Concert Series: NEC Chamber Orchestra + Palma
